body_html:
Hi @arinbjornk, thanks for pointing this out.

In general it isn't necessary for the tutorial to match the provided code exactly. In this case, since the relevant folder is just the location where the downloaded data is stored, I think using a location inside /tmp and having a modifiable flag is slightly preferable to just hard-coding a relative path.
body_text:
Hi @arinbjornk, thanks for pointing this out.
In general it isn't necessary for the tutorial to match the provided code exactly. In this case, since the relevant folder is just the location where the downloaded data is stored, I think using a location inside /tmp and having a modifiable flag is slightly preferable to just hard-coding a relative path.
body:
Hi @arinbjornk, thanks for pointing this out.

In general it isn't necessary for the tutorial to match the provided code exactly. In this case, since the relevant folder is just the location where the downloaded data is stored, I think using a location inside `/tmp` and having a modifiable flag is slightly preferable to just hard-coding a relative path.
